medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive hypogonadism in male infants characterized by lack of penile growth and involution of the scrotum.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in early infancy, with progressive atrophy of the external genitalia noted at 1-4 months of age. Duration and intensity of symptoms varied, with both cases showing a lack of expected physiological rise in testosterone.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Case 1: Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism. Case 2: Panhypopituitarism with GH deficiency in family history. Case 3: Panhypopituitarism with adrenal insufficiency diagnosed at birth.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal uncle with GH deficiency in Case 2.
